main_business: Electronics Distribution & Recycling / Global Mineral Trading
description: CCQT Inc. is an R2v3 certified international wholesaler and global leader in electronics distribution, recycling, and IT asset disposition (ITAD). They provide comprehensive services including data security, asset buyback, grading, and scrap collection. The company has expanded into global mineral trading through its CCQT Minerals division, sourcing and trading essential minerals like sulfur, phosphate rock, and iron ore.
products_services: Global Mineral Trading (Sulfur, Phosphate Rock, Iron Ore)
physical_address: Headquarters: 2915 21 ST NE, Suite 112, T2E 7T1, Calgary, Alberta, Canada. Operations: 66 E Escalon Ave, Fresno, CA, 93710.
summary:
CCQT Inc. is a Canadian corporation and global leader in electronics distribution, recycling, and IT asset disposition. Founded in 2021 as a family-run business, the company has rapidly expanded, opening a facility in California by 2023 and serving clients in over 22 countries. Their core services revolve around the complete electronics lifecycle, offering R2v3 certified recycling, secure NIST-compliant data destruction, asset buyback, transparent grading, and scrap collection. They emphasize environmental responsibility, data security, and maximizing value recovery from used electronics.

In addition to its electronics focus, CCQT has established CCQT Minerals, a division dedicated to the global trading of essential minerals such as sulfur, phosphate rock, and iron ore. This expansion leverages their international logistics and trading expertise into commodity supply chains for agriculture, chemical manufacturing, steel, and energy industries. The company operates facilities in Calgary, Alberta (headquarters) and Fresno, California, and is certified to the highest industry standards including R2v3, RIOS, and NIST SP 800-88, ensuring compliance, transparency, and sustainable practices across all operations.
